resource_data.description: Here are some useful links and documents:

slidetranscripts.slidetranscript: [No Audio]

Avery:

Come in, come in! I'm Avery.

Jake:

…and I'm Jake.

Avery:

I was just about to teach Jake how to make a pizza. Would you like to join us? <pause> Great! Let's get started.

Making a pizza is broken into three quick missions - Create Dough, Assemble Pizza, and Bake Pizza. In each mission you'll watch first, then try. After that, we'll test your knowledge.
[No Audio]
[No Audio]
[No Audio]
[No Audio]
[No Audio]
[No Audio]
[No Audio]
[No Audio]
[Music]

Avery:

Ready for Mission 1? It’s time to create a stretch-ready dough.

First, check your measurements. Then add ingredients in order – water, salt, oil – then flour and yeast. When it’s mixed, knead it into a dough ball, place it in an oil-coated bowl, and cover it with a towel. Ready, Jake?

Jake:

Got it… water, oil, flour, salt, yeast – just like the recipe says...

Avery:

Careful, what’s not on this page is that salt can make your dough flat if it touches the yeast – a little expert tip for you.

Avery:

Now it’s your turn! Drag the ingredients on the left to the bowl on the right in the appropriate order to make your dough.

Avery:

Making dough sounds easy… and it is. Just keep these things in mind:

· Before you mix, double-check your measurements

· Always add ingredients in the exact order listed in the recipe

· Prepare a warm, dry place for dough to rise

· Be patient… waiting longer can make more manageable dough

Avery:

Ready for Mission 2? It’s time to assemble a bake-ready pizza.

Watch me… we’ll preheat the oven, spread flour on the workspace, and prep a pan with a non-stick spray. Carefully stretch from the inside out. Pull around the edges to stretch the dough into a flat, round circle. Then, place it on the pan. Use the back of a spoon to spread sauce in circles, sprinkle cheese evenly across the pie, and add your toppings. Your turn!

Jake:

mmm…Okay. Oh… I forgot to flour the surface. Better spray the pan so I don’t have the same issue there.

Avery:

Exactly.

Avery:

Now it’s your turn! Drag the items on the left to the pan on the right in the appropriate order to assemble your pizza.

Avery:

To sum up, here are some tips to remember when you do this again:

· Turn on the oven first, so it has time to preheat

· Prep your workspace by spraying the pan and flouring the countertop – you don’t want the dough to stick or break apart

· Use flour sparingly when stretching dough – too much can leave a pasty coating on your cooked pie

· Don’t center load – distribute your sauce, cheese, and toppings around the pizza so it cooks evenly

Avery:

Ready for Mission 3? It’s time to bake a pizza to recipe-set crispiness.

Okay. First, make sure the pizza is on racks centered in the oven for even cooking, then set your timer. Be sure to check the pizza regularly. You will know it’s baked to perfection once the crust is golden brown and the cheese is lightly toasted. Remove the pizza and allow it to cool before cutting.

Jake:

Got it… in the oven, timer on, watching carefully… then eating with delight.

Avery:

Yes, nice job – be sure to let it cool so you don’t burn yourself!

Avery:

Let’s assume it’s up to you to coach Jake. Which of the following can result in a burnt crust?

Avery:

When you go to bake your pizza, keep these important tips in mind:

· Be sure the rack is positioned in the center of the oven to help the hot air circulate

· Don’t forget to set the timer – you don’t want your pizza to burn!

· Check your pizza, even though the timer is set, to make sure the cheese melts and dough is crisp.

Avery:

Thanks for your help today! Jake will be making pizzas on his own in no time. Now, we’ll assess YOUR pizza making knowledge. You will see 5 questions. Answer them correctly and you pass. Miss any, and you must take the quiz again. Click Next when you are ready to start.
